etymons.meaning: stark, kräftig, mächtig sein oder werden

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: qay abri? hawi gušmux qawi w hawi foṯux saməq
translations: wieso denn, mein Sohn? Ist denn dein Körper nicht schon kräftig und dein Gesicht frisch rot geworden?

tokens.value: qay abri? hawi gušmux qawi w hawi foṯux saməq
ʻwieso denn, mein Sohn? Ist denn dein Körper nicht schon kräftig und dein Gesicht frisch rot geworden?ʼ

Preterit Intransitive.text: qay abri? hawi gušmux qawi w hawi foṯux saməq ʻwieso denn, mein Sohn? Ist denn dein Körper nicht schon kräftig und dein Gesicht frisch rot geworden?ʼ; 617; 76/140;

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: hano ġắlabe qawi b-lebe ḏ̣əd d-aloho hul dáraǧe d-ko-mankər u=wuǧūd d-aloho
translations: ‘He was strongly disaffected against God to such an extent that he denied the very existence of God’

tokens.value: hano ġắlabe qawi b-lebe ḏ̣əd d-aloho hul dáraǧe
‘He was strongly disaffected against God to such an extent that he denied the very existence of God’

Preterit Intransitive.text: hano ġắlabe qawi b-lebe ḏ̣əd d-aloho hul dáraǧe, d-ko-mankər u=wuǧūd d-aloho ‘He was strongly disaffected against God to such an extent that he denied the very existence of God’; 43/6 [MT]

translations: vielleicht wird er dann ein wenig kräftig

tokens.value: ʻvielleicht wird er dann ein wenig kräftigʼ

Infectum.text: balki qowe əšmo ʻvielleicht wird er dann ein wenig kräftigʼ; 617; 76/133;

Infectum.turoyo: kət-lan arwono g-nəḥrina-le saymina-le qaliyo w-gəd-muklina-le l-u=zʕur-ano balki qowe əšmo w-gušme miʕadəl
translations: ‘We have a calf. We are going to slaughter it and prepare a piece of meat from it and we are going to feed it to the boy. Perhaps he will get a bit stronger, and his body will be in a good condition’

tokens.value: kət-lan arwono g-nəḥrina-le saymina-le qaliyo w-gəd-muklina-le l-u=zʕur-ano balki qowe əšmo w-gušme miʕadəl
‘We have a calf. We are going to slaughter it and prepare a piece of meat from it and we are going to feed it to the boy. Perhaps he will get a bit stronger, and his body will be in a good condition’

Infectum.text: kət-lan arwono g-nəḥrina-le saymina-le qaliyo w-gəd-muklina-le l-u=zʕur-ano balki qowe əšmo w-gušme miʕadəl ‘We have a calf. We are going to slaughter it and prepare a piece of meat from it and we are going to feed it to the boy. Perhaps he will get a bit stronger, and his body will be in a good condition’ 76/133;

Preterit.turoyo: ʕal d-maqwele foṯe ġắlabe ašər mḥéli-le lakmo ʕal foṯe
translations: Since he was very importunate, sure I gave him a slap in the face

tokens.value: ʻSince he was very importunate, sure I gave him a slap in the faceʼ

Preterit.text: ʕal d-maqwele foṯe ġắlabe, ašər, mḥéli-le lakmo ʕal foṯe ʻSince he was very importunate, sure I gave him a slap in the faceʼ; 617; 43/53;
ono… maqweli lebi ‘ich fasste mir ein Herz’; 116/32;

Preterit.turoyo: yawmo həngi maqwele ʕal u=babo omər adyawma lo=k-owe illa g-əzzino qm-aʕ=ʕeze ono w-hat g-məṯnoḥət
translations: ‘One day he pestered his father, saying: “Today I am certainly going with the goats, and you are going to take a rest” 75/52; hat maqwelux aʕli b-u=šeyolo w-hul d-məllilux u=mede d-kət-wa b-lebi ‘You have pestered me with questions to the point that I told what was on my mind’

tokens.value: yawmo həngi maqwele ʕal u=babo omər adyawma lo=k-owe illa g-əzzino qm-aʕ=ʕeze ono w-hat g-məṯnoḥət

‘One day he pestered his father, saying: “Today I am certainly going with the goats, and you are going to take a rest” 75/52; hat maqwelux aʕli b-u=šeyolo w-hul d-məllilux u=mede d-kət-wa b-lebi ‘You have pestered me with questions to the point that I told what was on my mind’

Preterit.text: yawmo həngi maqwele ʕal u=babo omər adyawma lo=k-owe illa g-əzzino qm-aʕ=ʕeze ono w-hat g-məṯnoḥət ‘One day he pestered his father, saying: “Today I am certainly going with the goats, and you are going to take a rest” 75/52; hat maqwelux aʕli b-u=šeyolo w-hul d-məllilux u=mede d-kət-wa b-lebi ‘You have pestered me with questions to the point that I told what was on my mind’ 82/37;

translations: so habe ich mir Mut zugesprochen, liebe Brüder

tokens.value: ‘so habe ich mir Mut zugesprochen, liebe Brüder’

Infectum.text: hawxa ko-maqweno b-lebe d-ruḥi, aḥunone ‘so habe ich mir Mut zugesprochen, liebe Brüder’; LB 162;

translations: Hul d kətno saġ (gmaqweno ak qawetyatayḏi ʕal ann abnayḏi stene) tark didux lǝgbǝn (= lobǝn). Towat hat waziro, hul d kətna saġ, towat waziro hat.

tokens.value: “Hul d kətno saġ (gmaqweno ak qawetyatayḏi  ʕal ann abnayḏi stene) tark didux lǝgbǝn (= lobǝn). Towat hat waziro, hul d kətna saġ, towat waziro hat.”

Infectum.text: Omar: “Hul d kətno saġ (gmaqweno ak qawetyatayḏi ʕal ann abnayḏi stene) tark didux lǝgbǝn (= lobǝn). Towat hat waziro, hul d kətna saġ, towat waziro hat.”

translations: As long as I am alive..., I will commit my instructions [by means of testament] also to my sons, they will not leave you [lit.: give your leaving]. You shall be vizier, as long as we are alive, you shall be vizier.

tokens.value: “As long as I am alive..., I will commit my instructions [by means of testament] also to my sons, they will not leave you [lit.: give your leaving]. You shall be vizier, as long as we are alive, you shall be vizier.”

Infectum.text: He said: “As long as I am alive..., I will commit my instructions [by means of testament] also to my sons, they will not leave you [lit.: give your leaving]. You shall be vizier, as long as we are alive, you shall be vizier.”

idioms: stark machen, (foṯe ʕal) zudringlich werden, jm. zusetzen;
maqwe/maqwele III to have a wish/desire; to make a testament/last will
